Hoping someone can help me with this HubDB puzzle. So I have a large table (> 6000 rows) and I want to query the table for rows with specific IDs which is a number field. The problem is that I have like 20 ids/rows to pull. Since the HubDB filters only does AND conditions (OR is not supported), I have to resort to looping and calling the API for each ID/row.  Now there there’s a limit on HubDB calls, this no longer works.

I tried using the __contains filter but that doesn’t work on “number” fields.

Any help is most appreciated.
So we are experiencing an issue where HubDB is not appearing in IE11 browser. Can anyone else recreate this on their sites?
We've tested two hubdbs but they are from the same portal.
cc <@UGHH72Q4Q> :point_up_2:
not appearing in the navigation on <http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>?
According to our QC person. It wasn't showing on the page
I'll dm you a link
Hmm, that’s a good suggestion. We’ll look at adding support for IN on number fields.
Note that the limit is not enforced on `hubdb_table_row` (just `hubdb_table_rows`) function, but it will eventually.
